page.title: 01Ilkeston and Kirk Hallam
page.content: Most of this area lies to the south of Ilkeston town centre. It is a mixture of farmland and fairly densely populated areas. Kirk Hallam consists chiefly of two housing estates, one council and one private and this district has its own community school where many varied activities take place. The areas around Hallam Fields and Little Hallam show a greater variety of housing, old and new, with fewer and much smaller estates. The natural centre of Ilkeston is the Market Place where the parish church of St. Mary's, the public library, the Town Hall and the Police Station are all to be found in close proximity. It is here and in the adjoining streets that the annual October fair is held, and this is one of the major attractions of the town. Textiles is an important industry.
